fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9363].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. 

This capability is now available using the new "Create project with shared configuration" feature, which was released to all versions of JIRA at the beginning of October 2015 (JIRA 7.0). When creating a new project, simply click the "Create with shared configuration" link in the bottom-left corner of the dialog, choose an existing project, and a new project will be creating that shares the same workflow scheme (and other schemes) of the existing project. [More documentation is available here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/defining-a-project-749382822.html#Definingaproject-createCreatingaproject].

We recognize that this is not exactly the same as setting a workflow scheme as "default". Simplifying project setup, configuration, and maintenance is one of the JIRA team's top priorities right now. We are in the early stages of a big investment in making it easier to get started with a JIRA project and maintain a large number of projects at scale.

We will continue to work in this area and intend to provide more comprehensive support for this in the future.

It's important to understand that we rarely try to implement individual features from jira.atlassian.com, but instead take a holistic look at the problem and use feedback from the comments here and a [dozen other sources|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com] of customer input to solve the core problems.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or feedback.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

We have set up a custom workflow scheme that we'd like to use on all new projects.
We need to specify that this custom scheme should be used by default for new projects -- without explicitly specifying it on Administer Project page.

Alternative solution would be to have Workflow Scheme selector right at the Create Project screen, so that admins have a reminder that it should be specified in some way.
fields.summary: user-defined workflow scheme as default for new projects
Add the ability to allow and set screen refresh times

fields.description:
I just want to express the disappointment that I feel that the professional version of JIRA does not allow "Default Component Assignees".
My company recently moved from Bugzilla to JIRA and relied on this feature of bugzilla.  It seems to me to be a rather basic feature, that a $2400 issue tracker should have.  When you have a project with 10 or 15 people on it, its a pain in the a** to have to reassign every bug to the appropriate person. I think this is a significant oversight in the feature/license matrix, especially for those of us migrating from bugzilla.
fields.summary: Disappointment about "component leads"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9354].
  {panel}

1) for 3.6 (or later if not posible) :
We would like to be able to have a custom field type that allows us to select information (field) from user's profile.

NOTE : that would become more usefull when linked issue http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1519 will be resolved.

2) for 4.0 (or later if not posible) :
calculate something... using several fields... or fields from issue and from user's profile....
ex : substring, concatenates, regexpr... or math depending on field type.

NOTE : that's probably not so important as i think we can make it with plug-ins. but the best is to be able to do it the easyest way...
fields.summary: CustomField UserInfo
Display 'Issue Type' icon of link in issue links area of issue view
Investigate and change if possible the rpc plugin to generate document/literal wrapped WSDL
Add a 'Version Lead'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9313].
  {panel}

Hi,

it would be very helpful to have some more user data in the user profile, e.g. (and most important for me) a *phone number*.
A generic field 'Further Info' could hold various other data relevant to the environment.

Would be glad to see it in the future,
anton
fields.summary: Additional User Info
Create Link to new issue created via Move

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9311].
  {panel}

I wish I can configure the assignable list in  every step of a workflow, maybe by group memership.
For example in software development, one step is "user tests", and this people is outside the main development group, so it's  only when in a workflow is in  the "user tests" only this people can be assignable.

thanks

Alvaro Alonso
Bogota, Colombia, (South America)
fields.summary: Assignable user restricted upon workflow steps
Components per Issue Type
Work Log: number of hours per day must be project-specific setting, NOT global
Produce Gannt Chart for project component

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9295]. {panel} We would like to see custom rendering for user names throughout JIRA. For instance, we have inactive users in our system (members of the inactive-user group). When the name of an inactive user group is displayed, we would like to render them on the screen as Joe user and in email templates as Joe User (disabled) We can manually do this by (example from view_details.jsp) : "> "> It would be optimal that all user rendering either be "macroized" or use a common tag that could be extended once. there appear to be ~100 unique places in which users are rendered - customizing them all doesn't make sense. Making this change would set JIRA up to support better user management by distinguishing between external and internal users, admins etc.
fields.summary: Create extensible rendering for user names (reporter,assignee,lead) etc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9292].
  {panel}

Hi,

Would it be possible to implement a similar feature to that of Confluence that was recently developed where the drafts are saved at certain intervals so in case of a server crash they could easily be recovered? We have just experienced a crash and the users who lost their work expressed their frustration.

Thank you
Ahmet

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by third-party browser plugins such as [Lazarus Form Recovery|http://getlazarus.com/download] that save the form data in a database in the browser.
fields.summary: Auto-save comments
Wish: Send the emails encrypted using PGP
Service properties not i18n'd properly
Configurable "None" option and radio buttons and checkboxes alignment in Custom Fields
Bulk Change Issue Assignee (even for closed/uneditable issues)

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9227]. {panel} Hello, I would like to be able to associate a trouble ticket to another application using a URI such as the example below. > > Hello, > I'm attempting embed a link from Concluence or Jira to a URI. I can accomplish this easily in a simple web page, example below, but can not figure out if it is possible in your products. Here is what works -- I have no problem with http links, I believe what I'm attempting here is a URN, do you all support it or am I doing something stupid? > > href="steeltrace:remote:168602293894393527#945748728664393527"> > FR12: Weekly Schedule and Control > >
fields.summary: Allow ticket to support URI links
Add option through the RPC interface
SOAP addAttachments should have an alternative more efficient implementation

fields.description: It would be nice to see the numbers of open assigned issues adjencent to the full name in the picklist of assignable users. Example: Annicka Rosengren (12).
fields.summary: Number of issues assign displayd next to assignee

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9201].
  {panel}

As we are using JIRA also as kind of a service desk tool, it would be very helpful, to easily identifiy issues, which are overdue. (todays date > due date). For this reason a new feature should be implemented:

1a. Create a Switch in "user preferences" called "highlight overdue issues"
1b. Create a switch on the search issue page, where you can dynamically switch highlighting on and off.
2. Highlight every row in a filter result in "light red" , where the due date is yesterday or older
3. Highlight every row in a filter result in "yellow", where the due date is today.
4. Do not highlight anything else.

Would be great to easily see, which tasks are overdue, and which tasks are still in time.

My guess: about 1-2 days of effort. What do you think?
fields.summary: Highlight issues red, which are late or overdue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9197].

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

h3. Summary
Since sub-tasks are directly related to their parents, those should be displayed in hierarchic order on the *Issue Navigator*. Something similar is already applied on Agile boards, for example.

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Sort Issue Navigator by parent-children pairs
Support syncronization to handheld devices

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9190].
  {panel}

There is currently no way for users to reliably search on closed issues by date through the filter interface.  We are currently handicapped by the following set of problems...

1.  There is no system defined "closed date" that can be used via the filter interface
2.  The system doesn't support the definition of a hidden custom field that can be defaulted to the current date for closure
3.  Default dates always default to 01-Jan-01 if I were inclined to try to leave the closure date visible on a screen and default it for users.

It sure would be handy to have this functionality.
fields.summary: No closure date exposed through the filter interface
Fix TestImportExport functional test
Would like to see configurable fields for the column view of subtasks when viewing issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9179].
  {panel}

I'm implementing a project for managing our hiring process. A high-level requirement I have is for a report that shows who is holding on to issues too long and slowing up the hiring queue.

Dimensions to report on:
- project
- user
- issue type
- status
- amount of time a user has held the issue

How awesome would it be to have this data exported into an Excel pivot table? This would allow managers to easily slice-n-dice the data to police the Project.
fields.summary: Report showing which users are holding up the queue
Enable Wiki Renderering for the Work Log description field
Auto (bulk) assign to reporter or project lead
Create rss/xml links by string instead of by id

fields.description:
Add additional information for the attachments field.  Please refer to JRA-6765 for the original post and screenshot.

Perfect solution would be to make this configurable.  We feel the attached patch feels a little cluttered.
fields.summary: Add aditional information to Attachments field (make configurable)

fields.description: The columns visible in the sub-task table for the View Issue page should be customisable
fields.summary: Customise sub-task table layout
Cache the Mail Connection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9142].
  {panel}


The custom renderer api looks great. We have several fields we would like to customise.

However the time/effort overhead for creating custom renderers is large. For all of our custom
fields (and I'd imagine most peoples needs), a simple regex substitution would be perfect.

This renderer would contain a list of regex, substituion pairs and would call replaceAll for
each pair in order.
fields.summary: Regular expression renderer
Allow an admin user to turn on/off Jelly support in the Administation section
Delete Custom Field Context

fields.description:
A user request:

I want the ability to attach my *User Acceptance Testing Signoffs* to the release notes as opposed to each individual ticket that make up that release.
fields.summary: Add ability to save files against a saved release note.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9107].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 19 March 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This is a routine update of this issue. While this issue is not currently on our roadmap, we do hope to address it in the future.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

Security levels allow JIRA issue visibility to be altered per issue, instead of just per project (as with permission schemes). However, currently security levels can only be set by hand (although a default may apply).

It would be great if we could provide a flexible workflow post-function, which set the security level of an issue based on various configurable criteria. For instance:
 - The reporter's group (JRA-5276).
 - The issue type (JRA-4794).
 - The issue's component (JRA-3838).
fields.summary: Create post-function to set security level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9100].
  {panel}

Please add issue type and resolution to release notes, and also grouping by component would be nice.  Perhaps an option to include subtasks or not (default not).

Example format:

Release Notes:

  User Interface
    PRJ-001  Fixed          New Feature    - Add a goodby screen
    PRJ-002  Fixed          Bug                    - First name cut off on toolbar

  Database
    PRJ-003  Wont Fix     Bug                    - Name Sort is case-sensitive
fields.summary: Allow user configure inclusion of issue type within release notes on issue type definition.
Poll or survey support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9091].

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

*Original request description*
 
Enable a default value for the "Comment Viewable By" field. This could be set in the user preferences.
Please also consider adding this option per project, and not just a global default.
fields.summary: Default value for "Comment Viewable By"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9081].
  {panel}

1. Go to Find Issues
2. Open Components / Versions for Fitting Software
3. Observe the contents of Fix For, Affects Versions, etc.
JIRA >>> most of those contents are truncated, none of these methods will help : resize IE into full screen, hovering mouse pointer on particular value that has long chars, tried to expand the control area (left hand side area with those control fields)
fields.summary: Components / Versions fields does not have a tool tips or cannot be extended, therefore if the content is long enough it will be truncated and difficult to read
Cannot specify "NULL" in multiselect searcher custom field
Negative user / group filter
Automaticaly watch an issue once you re-assign it
Ability to assign an issue to a selected component's lead developer
Would like to be able to retrieve an issue's Change History through API.
AddComments: AlwaysShow by default
Track fixing of an issue in each fix-for version separately

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9042].
  {panel}

Quick search by default creates a new filter with no project selected. My suggestion is to have it inherit the current context's project selection.

* So if I'm at the home page, it creates a non-project filter.
* If I'm in Issue Navigator then it uses whatever the current filter's project selection is.
* If I'm in a bug, then it uses that bug's project.

Perhaps control this with a little checkbox next to "Quick Search" called "Use current project"...? See the problem I have is that every time I use quick search I always have to go back and narrow the results. I understand that I can include the project's code in the search terms but that's just not as Quick. Plus it may be a pain if I've got an issue navigator open for multiple projects.
fields.summary: Quick Search - add checkbox for "in current project"..?
Remove issue cache

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9016].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would have been nice to be able to bulkchange subtasks when editing an Issue. F.ex. if I edit an issue and want to change Fix Version and Due Date, and my issue has 10 subtasks that I also want to change these fields in, it would be great to have a checkbox or something that says "Also change subtasks".
fields.summary: Bulk change subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-9014].
  {panel}

I am currently evaluating Jira and it is the last point to confirm if our company will purchase it....  I would like the permission model supports "Reporter's Group".  See the following examples will explain the reason why it is very helpful:

1) We have several products, e.g Product1, Product2 ....
     Each product has its own component, version & release note
2) We support several dealers worldwide, e.g. Dealer1, Dealer2, ....
    Each dealer is a "User Group" associating with a set of logins
4) We have a central support team for all dealers
5) However, it is critical that dealer should see ONLY his issues but not other dealers' issues

So, I will setup project like
   Product 1 Support Area    (with all component, version, release note setup properly)
   Product 2 Support Area
   ....
   However, the above cannot be achieved because there is no "Reporter's Group" permission for viewing the project 

Because of the limitation, I need to create many project like:
    Product 1 Support Area for Dealer 1
    Product 1 Support Area for Dealer 2
    ....
    Product 2 Support Area for Dealer 1
    Product 2 Support Area for Dealer 2
    ....

And I need to duplicate all component, version & release note info into many projects.  Also, the issue finder will be more difficult to use.

In fact, most IT companies have the similar workflow that they have several products & dealers .... but because of the sensivity of sales issues (some business deals cannot be seen by other dealers), all issues should be private to dealer group only.  I wish Jira will support this.  Many many thks.
fields.summary: Add "Reporter Group" Permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8998].
  {panel}

I would like the ability to create a listing of an adhoc set of issues.  One thing that I thought could be useful in facilitating this would be the addition of tags to an issue.

Similar to how Amazon lets you tag any products with a label that is meaningful to you, or how flickr.com and http://del.icio.us let you tag photos  and bookmarks.

Once I have the ability to tag issues, I should then be able to easily get a listing of all the issues with that tag.

One thing that I would use this functionality for now is to be able to tag issues that were reviewed (or should be reviewed) in a meeting.  I'd apply the same tag to all of them and then run my filter and publish the results.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to add tags to issues and then create filters based on the tags
Link directly to user profile in comments
The JIRA Updater no longer works (and currently fails in windows)
Attach Files to Service Request
Restrict cookie-based login to SSL users
Consider adding a SOAP service to get all users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8966].
  {panel}

There are a few general configuration properties that influence the operations and values that are allowable when calling the remote interface.  Examples of such properties are:
* Allow users to vote on issues
* Allow users to watch issues
* Allow unassigned issues

I need to know the value of these properties to correctly show/hide various actions.

A service that returned name/value pairs would be sufficient.
fields.summary: SOAP service to list general configuration properties

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8960].
  {panel}

Is it possible to expand the FIND ISSUES screen with something like the following option?:
"Has been assigned to"

It will help us to report on which persons have been working on an issue

At this moment we "only"have the following options:
"Reporter",
"Assignee"
fields.summary: expanding Find Issue  screen filtering (2)

fields.description: I think the current Specify User field is almost useless. How am I supposed to know someone's username? It would be best to replace the current user filter system entirely with a user search, which searches name and username. This way I could search for issues reported by Keith to find my issues, and maybe some by other people named Keith.
fields.summary: Replace "Specify User" select box with username search field
Priority +/- buttons
closing parent should close any open sub tasks that are still open
WYSIWYG / Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8938].
  {panel}

We would like to exclude Versions from the current dashboard issue counts.

For example if I have these versions in my project FOO.

F1-M1
F1-M2
F1-M3
F1-RC
F2-M1

I'd like to be able to exclude "F2-M1" since that is a future version that we are not working on yet, and that we are postponing issue to.  This skews our dashboard numbers for our current drive to zero issues.
fields.summary: Allow Limiting by Version for Browser Project Open Issues Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8934].
  {panel}

I archived an older version of the project since it was released a while ago and no further development was going against it.
Then, I re-opened a resolved issue that had been previously set as 'Fix For' that version. I didn't visit the Fix version field on my additional info screen so I didn't notice what it said, but presumably, it wouldn't have shown the older version in the dropdown because, being archived, it won't show that version anymore.
So, after re-opening the issue, i ended up with an issue scheduled to be fixed for a very old version.
The app should warn me if re-opening an issue for an archived version.
fields.summary: Re-opening issue against archived version doesn't prompt user for new version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8926].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team. We are planning on making modifications to default issue type schemes in JIRA 7.0 which will support the functionality described in this issue. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It should be possible to choose which issue type scheme is used by default for the newly created project
fields.summary: It should be possible to choose which issue type scheme is used by default
Include best practice workflows with JIRA
add "Shortcut Links" like Confluence has to JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8898].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

The Original Estimate field, which in JIRA is displayed as 1 day, 2 days, 2 weeks, etc. is converted to seconds per 7-hour day when it reaches Excel.  For example, a task that is 1 day in JIRA appears as 25200 in Excel.

I see a bug where this was done in order to implement sorting of time, but is there a way to switch this back to preserve the original date formatting - we don't need to sort by second and we would like to not have to manually reconvert back to dates.
fields.summary: Original Estimate field's Excel export format should be configurable
Scheme inheritance: define schemes in terms of other schemes, to factor out commonalities
"Schedule" permission should include ability to set fix version

fields.description:
Instead of "Schedule After" [Dropdown: versions, "--- Before First Version ---"], which is a little confusing. It would be cleaner to express this as...

Schedule [Dropdown: before/after] version [Dropdown: versions]
fields.summary: Improve add version input

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8885].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 17 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We've recently received some commentary through other channels,  so I thought I would provide an update to reiterate our position on this issue.

JIRA's voting system was initially designed for cases where JIRA served as a public bug tracker or feature request management system, like [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com] or [issues.apache.org/jira|http://issues.apache.org/jira].

As JIRA has matured, we have focused more and more on teams using JIRA for internal software development. Voting provides a useful way to capture quantitative feedback when your issues are public; however, it is not intended as a way for small development teams to prioritize their work.

*We recognize that everyone uses JIRA differently*, and that not having this feature makes it more difficult for teams to implement a strict prioritization-by-voting process with JIRA. However, *our current focus* is on improving the usability and performance for teams planning using components, versions, backlogs and boards. In short, additional functionality for voting is not a priority for us for the foreseeable future.

If you have any questions, please email me. dmeyer@atlassian.com

Thanks,
Dave Meyer
Prodct Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Currently, it is not possible for a reporter to vote for their own issue. It would be nice to allow reporters to vote for their issue - perhaps make this optional.

A use case would be:

"QA manager may log bugs but also be part of the committee that chooses bugs to be fixed via voting."
fields.summary: Allow reporters to vote
Need seach methods for SOAP should allow for paginaton

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8875].
  {panel}

Is there a way to perform a search based on date/time of the latest transition without developing a plug-in? For example it would be useful to search for issues that were closed at a certain date, or for issues that were moved from one state to another within x number of days.
This would be feasable if *"Transition post function"* *"Update issue field"* worked on date/time fields. Then I would have created a custom field called *"Transition Time"* and had it set to current date/time automatically during all transitions which I could easily perform a search on. Is it possible to extend *"Update issue field"* functionality to include the date/time fields?

Thanks
Ahmet
fields.summary: Transition timestamp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8874].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 15 November 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue. 

First, my apologies for not having an update on this new feature request for such a long time.

We have discussed this feature at length, and as we have no plans to implement this feature in the foreseeable future, we are closing this issue. 

We have prioritized improving screen editing for the existing transition, create, edit, and view screens, rather than adding more screens that can be customized. (You can see a number of improvements in JIRA 5.2 with screen editing). We have received a large amount of feedback on the need for simplification of the current project configuration in JIRA including the current screen editor, and we are focused on making the existing capabilities of managing fields and screens easier for new and existing customers to manage.

Given the large number of votes and compelling comments, we did not make this decision lightly or without taking all your comments into consideration. The decision to close a highly voted feature request is never an easy one.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach, even when we do not plan to solve a highly voted feature request.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}

*Original Description*
the user is JIRA-developer group which can have permission to schedule issue, check the assign issue screen that has due date with more other fileds. when assign an existed issue, only see 'Assign To', 'Update comment' and 'Comment viewable by', I don't see 'Due date'.
fields.summary: Cannot customize assign issue screen
Support browser text size in IE
Stop identical comments being posted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8846].
  {panel}

We are looking at instigating a more formal 'new feature' workflow and we were thinking about using subtasks for it. The basic idea is that all new features require that a design document is written and approved, that a test plan is created, that the feature is implemented etc. What we would like to do is whenever an issue of type 'new feature' is created have the standard subtasks automatically added to it.

Currently the only post functions I can add to Create Issue are:
1. Assign to reporter
2. Create comment
3. Update Issue Field

We would like to see "Add sub-task" added to this list. This would let us add each of the sub-tasks to be created, and would save us from having to write custom code.

Even better than this would be to allow this to be defined when creating an issue type. Currently you can specify:

1. Name
2. Description
3. Icon URL

It would be extremely cool to see a list of default subtasks for this issue type.
fields.summary: Support automatic adding of subtasks for particular issue types - add create sub task workflow post function
Should have default read-only workflow scheme

fields.description:
Hi,

JIRA has been running for a long period and it's great to experience such an uptime. One downside is that the catalina.out file grew to almost 300MB.

How can we configure JIRA's logging system to rotate catalina.out file daily, as is done with other files (e.g. atlassian-jira.2005-12-19.log)

Thanks,
Guillaume.

*Workaround*

Options to rotate catalina.out and detailed steps for using logrotate are documented at [How to Rotate the Catalina Log File|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+Rotate+the+Catalina+Log+File]
fields.summary: How to rotate Tomcat's catalina.out
Do not allow the last group with global admin permissions to be deleted
Support Administrative Plugin
An issue moved into a project is not seen as a Created Issue in the target project from a notification perspective.
Single Level Group By Report should be able to use built-in filters
subtask integrity checker
Support custom mail formats (new plugin type)
If a plugin fails to initialise it should be marked as inactive
Add attachment integrity checker
Remote API has useless setters on the Remote Objects
Project selector dropdown on Create new issue page should be configurable to list a subset of projects in the drop down selector when the number of projects is large.

fields.description: When we move a task from one project to another, the attachment files remain in the original task.
fields.summary: Moving an issue from one project to another doesn´t move the attachments
Version Scheduling is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8759].
  {panel}

Some customers want to _hide_ Jira from their Customers who lodge support requests though email.
They want the Customer not to know about Jira but rather interact purely by email.

The following are some of the problems that the current system has with this:
# When a user sends an email they will recieve an email back saying they have an account at Jira and can then log on.
# They should most probably be put into a special group. (could be specified in the service)
# They can log on to Jira (they should be blocked)  I.e. They should have *Use* permisions but not *Log on* permissions.
# They should receive Notifications without links back to the web pages. (Internal Users should still get the normal ones)
# By default these users will receive Notifications made by themselves.  The default should be set to False.

(That is all I can think of for now.....)
fields.summary: Email only interface to Jira
Add a custom screen property that hides the comment field.
